alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 9:42PM EDT until March 26 at 7:52PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Ohio... Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Barclay Messerly Road, McConnell East, and Knowlton Roads will be flooded and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Friday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EDT Friday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this evening to 8.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 10.9 feet early Sunday morning. It will fall below flood stage again early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.8 feet on 04/09/1938. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EDT.
